business.headline: Gold, silver dip slightly today. Is the recent rally losing steam?At the time of writing, at 12.00 pm, gold on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) was slightly down by 0.30%, trading at Rs 1,26,366 per 10 grams. Silver followed a similar trend, falling 0.69% to Rs 1,61,350 per kg.

Pine Labs shares extend rally after strong IPO debut. Details hereThe stock listed at Rs 242 on the Bombay Stock Exchange, which was a 9.5 percent premium to its issue price. It later surged to Rs 283.70, a gain of 28.5 percent from the issue level. Around 12.33 pm, the shares were trading at Rs 257.35, valuing the company at Rs 29,556.63 crore.

Investor who foresaw 2008 US home crisis closes hedge fund. Here's whyThe investor has spent the past year warning about what he sees as bubbles in the market. He has sharply criticised big technology stocks and the boom in artificial intelligence (AI).

Infosys share buyback record date today: What investors should knowInfosys is conducting the buyback through the tender offer route, where it will purchase shares at Rs 1,800 per share. This is more than 18% above the recent market price of around Rs 1,515.

Do taxpayers always get interest on delayed income tax refunds? Find outIf your income tax refund is taking longer than expected, you may wonder whether the tax department must pay you interest for the delay. The law does provide for interest, but not in every situation.

Capillary Technologies IPO Day 1: Check latest GMP and subscription statusCapillary operates in the AI-led SaaS and customer loyalty solutions space, serving more than 410 brands across 47 countries. The company turned profitable in FY25 after two years of losses, reporting Rs 14.15 crore in profit. Revenue increased to Rs 598 crore in FY25.

Pine Labs shares list at 10% premium: Should you hold or book profit now?Pine Labs' better-than-expected debut and strong institutional support boosted early sentiment, but analysts say elevated valuations and intense fintech competition mean investors should balance listing-day gains with disciplined, long-term positioning.

Can a daughter's name be removed from pension records? Government explainsSeveral departments had asked whether a daughter's name should be removed from the family list after an employee retires. To settle the confusion, the DoP&PW issued an Office Memorandum clearly stating that her name must stay in the records.

Adani Group to invest over Rs 1 lakh crore in Andhra Pradesh: ReportSpeaking at a state event on Friday, Karan Adani said the investments are aimed at expanding the conglomerate's infrastructure footprint in the southern state and strengthening its long-term presence in high-growth sectors.

Sagility share price jumps over 6% today. What's driving the rally?Sagility's shares jumped after a large block deal hit the tape, with buyers overpowering supply. The stock's sharp rise suggests traders are betting the stake sale won't derail its near-term momentum.
Pine Labs share price: Stock lists at 10% premium over IPO pricePine Labs shares opened at Rs 242 on the BSE and NSE. The listing performance was slightly better than grey market expectations.

Infosys, TCS, TechM, HCLTech down: Why are IT stocks falling today?At the opening bell, major IT names fell sharply. Infosys dropped 1.91%, Tech Mahindra slipped 0.66%, HCLTech fell 0.29%, and TCS declined 0.36%.

Muthoot Finance share price jumps 10% after Q2 results. Should you buy?Muthoot Finance's strong Q2 results, driven by record AUM and higher profits, pushed the stock up nearly 10%, though analysts warn that rich valuations may limit further upside in the near term.

Emmvee Photovoltaic Power IPO allotment: Here's how to check your statusThe offer, which remained open from November 11 to 13, saw demand pick up but stopped short of full subscription. It drew bids for 7.50 crore shares against 7.74 crore on offer, translating into an overall subscription of 0.97 times.

Sensex down nearly 300 points, Nifty above 25,800; Asian Paints jumps 3%Around 9:23 am, the Sensex slipped 255 points to 84,223, while the Nifty50 fell 81 points to 25,798. Broader markets were mixed, with no clear trend emerging across midcap and smallcap segments.

PhysicsWallah IPO allotment out: Check if you got shares, GMP, listing detailsThe PhysicsWallah IPO was subscribed 1.92 times. The retail portion subscribed 1.14 times, the QIB (ex-anchor) portion subscribed 2.86 times, while the NII portion subscribed 0.51 times.

Sebi proposes easing pre-IPO lock-in rules: What it meansUnder the current framework, if any shares are pledged, a six-month lock-in cannot be enforced until those pledges are sorted out. This leads to delays in the final stages of going public.
Bihar election results: Will the stock market rise or fall today?Market participants expect Friday's session to be volatile as investors wait to see whether the ruling alliance can retain power.

Montek Singh Ahluwalia backs India's move to sign FTA with US amid tariff tensionsFormer Planning Commission deputy chairman Montek Singh Ahluwalia praised India's approach to US tariff issues and supported signing an FTA. He also advocated for the inclusion of talented professionals from the private sector in public administration.

Government scraps 14 quality norms to ease burden on key manufacturing sectorsBy lifting mandatory BIS certification requirements, the government has effectively simplified compliance, eliminated overlapping testing procedures, and accelerated approvals for both manufacturers and importers

entertainment.headline: 'Black Panther' Chadwick Boseman to be honored with Hollywood Walk of Fame star Chadwick Boseman will be felicitated with a star on Hollywood's Walk of Fame on November 20. The late actor is best known as Black Panther in the Marvel Cinematic Universe

Kriti Sanon shares BTS moments with Dhanush ahead of Tere Ishk Mein trailer Kriti Sanon and Dhanush heightened anticipation for 'Tere Ishk Mein' as Kriti shared adorable selfies ahead of the trailer release, instantly sparking fan excitement. With viral songs, behind-the-scenes moments, and strong promotions, the romantic thriller is gearing up for its big November 28 release.

Ranveer Singh calls Deepika his grounding presence, reflects on natural chemistry Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone reunited for a new tourism campaign, opening up about their experiences working together and their distinct travel personalities.

Mona Singh recalls asking SRK to leave The Ba***ds set: You cannot be here Mona Singh shared a light-hearted moment from the sets of 'The Ba**ds of Bollywood', where she asked Shah Rukh Khan to leave because she felt too nervous performing in front of him. The recreated 'Duniya Haseeno Ka Mela' song has since gone viral, adding to the buzz around Aryan Khan's directorial debut.

Sarah Jessica Parker to Receive Carol Burnett Award at Golden Globes Sarah Jessica Parker will be honoured with the Carol Burnett Award at this year's Golden Globes, recognising her significant impact and achievements in television.

Linkin Park adds standalone Bengaluru show to India debut on January 23 Rock band Linkin Park has added a special standalone concert in Bengaluru on January 23, 2026. They are set to perform at Lollapalooza India 2026.

Prabhas's Spirit to start filming by November end, confirms Sandeep Vanga Director Sandeep Reddy Vanga announced that his next project, 'Spirit', starring Prabhas, will commence shooting by the end of November. The update clarifies speculation about the cast and highlights Prabhas's preparation for his role as an IPS officer.

Manoj Bajpayee supports Kanu Behl after Agra loses screens to big releases 'Agra', which premiered at Cannes in 2023, is scheduled for its India release on November 14 but is struggling to secure screens due to the dominance of major commercial releases. Actor Manoj Bajayee extended his support to the team.

De De Pyaar De 2 review: Bumpy but breezy Bollywood rom-com that does the jobRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025 'De De Pyaar De 2' is a fun, breezy rom-com that combines humour, family drama and familiar charm. The casting is awkward, but the film doesn't disappoint.

Mridul Tiwari says Bigg Boss 19 eviction twist was unfair: It felt like a joke In an exclusive conversation with India Today, Mridul Tiwari spoke about his disappointment over his 'Bigg Boss 19' exit. The YouTuber called the twist unfair.

Kalamkaval trailer: Enigmatic Mammootty embraces darkness in investigative drama The official trailer for 'Kalamkaval', starring Mammootty and Vinayakan, offers a glimpse into the film's mystery and hints at a dramatic confrontation between the lead characters.  The film will release in theatres on November 27.

Jaya Bachchan loses cool at paps, calls out their ill-mannered behaviour. Watch Jaya Bachchan recently lost her cool at an event, as a video of her tense exchange with the paparazzi has now surfaced online.

Agra review: Beyond cinematic reality, an alarming gender sensitisation callRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025 Director Kanu Behl's unflinching film Agra is a brave, uncomfortable story that uses stellar performances from Mohit Agarwal and Rahul Roy to deliver an in-your-face commentary on the genesis of violence and extreme sexual repression in patriarchy.

Nagarjuna gets emotional on Shiva re-release: A film that changed Indian cinema Nagarjuna marked the re-release of 'Shiva' with a deeply personal note, recalling the film's enduring impact and significance in his career. The film has been re-released in theatres after 36 years.

Salman Khan jams to Oo Jaane Jaana with Stebin Ben ahead of Da-Bangg tour. Watch Salman Khan participated in a live musical performance with Stebin Ben in Doha, Qatar, ahead of the 'Da-Bangg: The Tour Reloaded' concert scheduled for November 14.

SS Rajamouli issues passport invites for Globetrotter grand gala. See pics Attendees for the upcoming 'Globetrotter' event at Ramoji Film City must obtain special event passports, marking a shift from traditional passes as part of new crowd management measures. The grand event will take place on November 15 in Hyderabad.

Hailey Bieber shares about her collaboration with Justin on fashion label Skylrk Hailey Bieber has spoken about her experience co-designing pieces for Justin Bieber's new fashion brand, SKYLRK, and how the couple balances their professional and personal lives in the public eye.

The Great Pre-Wedding Show: The small Telugu film that deserves big attention At a time when Telugu cinema is navigating commercial fatigue and searching for fresh voices, 'The Great Pre-Wedding Show' emerges as a modest yet meaningful reminder of why small, idea-driven films still matter on the big screen.

Kaantha review: Dulquer Salmaan-Rana Daggubati's period drama soars, then stumblesRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025 Kaantha movie review: Director Selvamani Selvaraj's 'Kaantha', starring Rana Daggubati, Dulquer Salmaan, Samuthirakani and Bhagyashri Borse, is a period drama thriller. Powerful performances and excellent making see the film soar, and then plummet when it becomes an investigation drama.

general news.headline: Delhi bomber Dr Umar Nabi's Pulwama home blown up by security forcesDNA samples from the Red Fort blast site matched Dr Umar Nabi's mother, confirming his identity as officials linked him to the explosive-laden Hyundai i20 used in Monday's attack.

1st Test, Day 1 Live: Bumrah rampage continues in 2nd sessionIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA), 1st Test Day 1 Live Score: Jasprit Bumrah set the tone for India with two sharp wickets in the opening session, hitting his lengths perfectly and beating the bat regularly. Kuldeep Yadav added a crucial wicket of his own to keep South Africa in check. The hosts struggled to stitch together any real momentum on a tricky pitch and went into lunch at 105 for 3, under clear pressure.

Bill to end H-1B visa programme soon, says Republican CongresswomanRepublican Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene said she would be introducing a bill to end the H-1B visa programme, claiming US companies were misusing it to replace American workers. Her proposal would phase out the programme, with a temporary 10,000-visa exemption for medical professionals.

Tagore wanted two stanzas of Vande Mataram, Gandhi compared chant to Allahu AkbarVande Mataram represents the soul of India's freedom struggle. However, its provocative use as a slogan at times made Mahatma Gandhi equate it with Allahu Akbar. Despite the opposition from a section of Muslims, Congress leaders knew there couldn't be a better National Song. It was Rabindranath Tagore who separated two stanzas from the six others, and endorsed it as the National Song.

De De Pyaar De 2 review: Bumpy but breezy Bollywood rom-com that does the jobRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025'De De Pyaar De 2' is a fun, breezy rom-com that combines humour, family drama and familiar charm. The casting is awkward, but the film doesn't disappoint.

PK's ambitious Bihar debut fizzles, Jan Suraaj scores a zero, show trendsPrashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party, despite a high-profile campaign and contesting nearly all Bihar Assembly seats, has largely fallen short in its debut.
India's high diabetes burden is quietly breaking the nation's heartOn World Diabetes Day, top heart surgeon Dr. Ramakanta Panda takes stock of the spiralling threat of diabetes on heart health.

Aye Raja ji...: Maithili Thakur's song as Nitish Kumar heads for another termMaithi Thakur is maintaining a decisive lead in Alinagar as the NDA surged past the majority mark in statewide trends, with the BJP and JD(U) dominating early rounds of counting across Bihar.

Sudha Murty, Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw dance their hearts out to dhol beats. Video viralA video of Sudha Murty and Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw dancing to dhol beats at a wedding in Bengaluru has gone viral on social media.

Live: Jailed JDU leader Anant Singh inching towards victory, leads by 15,000 votesMokama Assembly Election Results 2025 Live Updates: The counting of votes for Mokama Assembly constituency in Bihar, which voted on November 6, 2025, in the first phase of the state elections and recorded a 64% voter turnout, is underway. Anant Kumar Singh of the JD(U), the sitting MLA, aims to retain his seat after previous victories in 2020 (as an RJD candidate) and 2015 (as an Independent). Meanwhile, RJD has fielded Veena Devi and Prashant Kishor's Jan Swaraj Party's Priyadarshi Piyush is in the fray, making Mokama one of the most keenly contested and high-profile battles of this election. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

NDA set to wrest Pataliputra, key Bihar bellwetherEarly trends from the Bihar count put the NDA far ahead, leading on 190 seats to the Mahagathbandhan's 50, with the alliance even breaching traditional RJD strongholds across the Patliputra belt.

Lalu's sons trail in Bihar, Tejashwi puts up fight, Tej Pratap set to loseTwo brothers, once pillars of the same party, now stand on opposite sides of Bihar's electoral battlefield. As Tej Pratap struggles to find footing with his new outfit, Tejashwi Yadav is trailing from RJD bastion Raghopur.

Video: Leopard leaps onto safari bus, claws woman's hand in BengaluruA woman was injured during a leopard safari at Bannerghatta National Park after the animal leapt onto a bus and clawed her through a mesh window. She is stable, and non-AC safari services have been halted for a safety review.

Jubilee Hills By-Election Result 2025 Live: Congress's Naveen Yadav leads by over 15,000 votes after round 6 Telangana's Jubilee Hills Assembly Bypoll Results Live: Counting begins for the Jubilee Hills by-election, which was held on November 11 and saw a 47.16% turnout till 5 PM.

BJP twists knife after NDA's Bihar landslide, Congress rakes up SIRBJP is poised for a decisive victory in Bihar with a two-thirds majority. The Congress alleges the Election Commissioner is acting against the people's will, intensifying political tensions.

Delhi kids may die earlier, be dumber, get sicker - and perform badly in schoolChildren in Delhi are breathing dangerously polluted air that threatens their health and future. This toxic environment risks early death, developmental harm, and poor academic outcomes for an entire generation.

Kaantha review: Dulquer Salmaan-Rana Daggubati's period drama soars, then stumblesRelease Date:Fri Nov 14, 2025Kaantha movie review: Director Selvamani Selvaraj's 'Kaantha', starring Rana Daggubati, Dulquer Salmaan, Samuthirakani and Bhagyashri Borse, is a period drama thriller. Powerful performances and excellent making see the film soar, and then plummet when it becomes an investigation drama.

Delhi bomber imposed Taliban-style rules: Al-Falah students during sting operationAfter speaking with several students and staff, the India Today team learnt that Dr Umar Mohammad, the suicide bomber of the i20 car blast near the Red Fort on November 10, followed strict segregation practices in his classroom. Students said he enforced the "Taliban model" during his lectures.

Bihar ki jeet humaari hai, ab Bangal ki baari hai, Minister said before NDA sweepUnion Minister Giriraj Singh, when counting began earlier today, predicted that the victory in Bihar would go to the NDA, and the current trends indicate that the alliance is heading towards a massive win.

Blue Origin catches rocket falling from space: Why it's a big dealThe New Glenn booster, standing over 320 feet tall and powered by seven advanced BE-4 engines, returned to a droneship named Jacklyn in the Atlantic Ocean.

Kids are fixing the planet while adults argue. Meet the doersFrom solar carts to lake clean-ups, these five young Indian innovators and changemakers are proving that age is no barrier to impact. This Children's Day, meet the students using science, creativity, and compassion to heal the planet — one invention, one tree, and one idea at a time.

In RJD bastion Bhojpur, NDA set to cause major upset, show leadsBhojpur election results: In the 2020 elections, the Mahagathbandhan dominated the Bhojpur belt, which comprises Sandesh, Barhara, Arrah, Agiaon, Tarari, Jagdishpur, and Shahpur constituencies.

Lakshya Sen stuns former world champion Loh Kean Yow to reach Japan Masters semisLakshya Sen secured a straight-games win over former world champion Loh Kean Yew to advance to the semifinals at the Kumamoto Masters Japan 2025. The Indian shuttler held off a late challenge from Loh, winning 21-13, 21-17 to set up a match against Japan's Kenta Nishimoto.

Do taxpayers always get interest on delayed income tax refunds? Find outIf your income tax refund is taking longer than expected, you may wonder whether the tax department must pay you interest for the delay. The law does provide for interest, but not in every situation.

sports.headline: Lakshya Sen stuns former world champion Loh Kean Yow to reach Japan Masters semis Lakshya Sen secured a straight-games win over former world champion Loh Kean Yew to advance to the semifinals at the Kumamoto Masters Japan 2025. The Indian shuttler held off a late challenge from Loh, winning 21-13, 21-17 to set up a match against Japan's Kenta Nishimoto.

Bauna bhi hai: Bumrah's LBW chat with Pant on stump mic for Bavuma goes viral Jasprit Bumrah's chat with Rishabh Pant about Temba Bavuma's height has gone viral. The incident occurred in the 13th over when Bumrah thought he had trapped the Proteas skipper in front of the stumps.

Watch: Ex-Spanish football chief Luis Rubiales pelted with eggs during book launch Luis Rubiales' book launch in Madrid turned chaotic when his uncle threw eggs at him, adding drama to a year marked by his conviction for the non-consensual kiss on Jenni Hermoso and a sweeping scandal that reshaped Spanish football.

On Paris attacks anniversary, France restrict World Cup qualification celebrations France qualified for the 2026 World Cup after a 4-0 victory over Ukraine, but the team kept post-match celebrations minimal in recognition of the 10th anniversary of the November 13, 2015 attacks in Paris.

End of the road for Sai Sudharsan? No.3 spot can't be a musical chairs game, says Chopra Aakash Chopra has slammed the decision to drop Sai Sudharsan from the playing XI for the Kolkata Test. Sudharsan was dropped from the game despite scoring an impressive 87 in the second Test against the West Indies.

Shubman Gill laughs off toss woes, says he's saving his luck for the WTC final IND vs SA, 1st Test Day 1: Shubman Gill brushed off another lost toss with a WTC final quip but said India's 'very hungry' Test side is ready for a strong start in South Africa, banking on early movement for pacers and key changes in the XI.

1st Test: No Rabada for SA; Axar, Pant return as India go with four spinners A fit-again Rishabh Pant, who had suffered an injury in England in July, replaced all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy, while Axar Patel was back inside in place of Sai Sudharsan in the playing XI as India opted to go with four spinners.

How Ronaldo could miss World Cup opener after first Portugal red card in 22 years Cristiano Ronaldo risks missing Portugal's World Cup opener after receiving the first red card of his international career in his 226th appearance. The dismissal in a crucial qualifier against the Republic of Ireland could lead to a multi-match ban.

Be honest with Mohammed Shami: Pujara tells BCCI to give selection clarity to pacer Cheteshwar Pujara has urged the selectors and the Indian team management to be honest with Mohammed Shami about his future with the national team. Shami has been forced to remain on the sidelines with him last playing a Test in 2023.

1st Test: No Rabada for SA; Axar, Pant return as India go with four spinners A fit-again Rishabh Pant, who had suffered an injury in England in July, replaced all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy, while Axar Patel was back inside in place of Sai Sudharsan in the playing XI as India opted to go with four spinners.

How Ronaldo could miss World Cup opener after first Portugal red card in 22 years Cristiano Ronaldo risks missing Portugal's World Cup opener after receiving the first red card of his international career in his 226th appearance. The dismissal in a crucial qualifier against the Republic of Ireland could lead to a multi-match ban.

Be honest with Mohammed Shami: Pujara tells BCCI to give selection clarity to pacer Cheteshwar Pujara has urged the selectors and the Indian team management to be honest with Mohammed Shami about his future with the national team. Shami has been forced to remain on the sidelines with him last playing a Test in 2023.

Pakistan military chief helped salvage Sri Lanka tri-nation series: Mohsin NaqviPakistan's interior minister, Mohsin Naqvi, said on Thursday that army chief General Asim Munir personally intervened to salvage the Sri Lankan cricket team's tour after the suicide attack in Islamabad.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: Are SRH ready to move on from Heinrich Klaasen?Sunrisers Hyderabad head into the IPL 2026 mini-auction with their biggest decision revolving around Heinrich Klaasen's hefty Rs 23-crore contract. Releasing him could free up vital purse space and reshape the franchise's entire rebuilding strategy.

1st Test, Day 1 Live: Bumrah rampage continues in 2nd sessionIndia (IND) vs South Africa (SA), 1st Test Day 1 Live Score: Jasprit Bumrah set the tone for India with two sharp wickets in the opening session, hitting his lengths perfectly and beating the bat regularly. Kuldeep Yadav added a crucial wicket of his own to keep South Africa in check. The hosts struggled to stitch together any real momentum on a tricky pitch and went into lunch at 105 for 3, under clear pressure.

Rajasthan Royals 2026 retentions: Another reset, another crossroadsRajasthan Royals stand at another crossroads. With Sanju Samson's future uncertain and a rebuild looming, the 2026 auction could define the franchise's identity. The question now: will RR finally commit to a clear direction?

Varun Chakravarthy named Tamil Nadu captain for Syed Mushtaq Ali TrophyVarun Chakravarthy has been appointed captain of Tamil Nadu for this season's Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. They begin their campaign against Rajasthan on November 26 in Ahmedabad.

Agra welcome home World Cup star Deepti Sharma with 10 km roadshowAgra turned out in huge numbers to welcome home Deepti Sharma after India's historic Women's World Cup win. The all-rounder received a 10km roadshow celebration as the city honoured her tournament-defining performances.

South Africa must frustrate Rishabh Pant and play on his emotions: Mark BoucherMark Boucher has advised South Africa to counter Rishabh Pant's aggressive batting by playing on his ego and employing strategic field placements in the upcoming Test series against India. Pant will be making a comeback to international cricket after four months having recently recovered from a toe fracture sustained in England.

Sports Minister urges dialogue as I-League clubs seek solution to AIFF–ISL deadlockSports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has stepped in as Indian football's crisis deepens, meeting I-League representatives to hear their concerns. He has urged AIFF, ISL and I-League stakeholders to begin constructive dialogue immediately.

Varun Chakravarthy named Tamil Nadu captain for Syed Mushtaq Ali TrophyVarun Chakravarthy has been appointed captain of Tamil Nadu for this season's Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. They begin their campaign against Rajasthan on November 26 in Ahmedabad.

Agra welcome home World Cup star Deepti Sharma with 10 km roadshowAgra turned out in huge numbers to welcome home Deepti Sharma after India's historic Women's World Cup win. The all-rounder received a 10km roadshow celebration as the city honoured her tournament-defining performances.

South Africa must frustrate Rishabh Pant and play on his emotions: Mark BoucherMark Boucher has advised South Africa to counter Rishabh Pant's aggressive batting by playing on his ego and employing strategic field placements in the upcoming Test series against India. Pant will be making a comeback to international cricket after four months having recently recovered from a toe fracture sustained in England.

Sports Minister urges dialogue as I-League clubs seek solution to AIFF–ISL deadlockSports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya has stepped in as Indian football's crisis deepens, meeting I-League representatives to hear their concerns. He has urged AIFF, ISL and I-League stakeholders to begin constructive dialogue immediately.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: Can RCB strengthen their Hazlewood-reliant pace attack?RCB's title-winning formula revolved around Josh Hazlewood's brilliance and Rajat Patidar's leadership. As they prepare for IPL 2026, the defending champions must expand their pace depth and find support for their Australian spearhead.

IND vs SA 1st Test Predicted XI: Will India field spin trio of Axar, Kuldeep, Washington?India face a genuine selection dilemma ahead of the first Test, with Shubman Gill admitting uncertainty over the bowling balance. The Eden Gardens surface has kept the door open for both a three-spinner and three-seamer combination.

Jemima Rodrigues Exclusive: Inside India's Historic World Cup Win & The Chase That Changed EverythingOn this India Today Special Report, World Cup champion Jemima Rodrigues speaks exclusively about the Indian Women's Cricket Team's historic 2025 World Cup victory. Rodrigues details the thrilling semi-final chase against Australia, her own unbeaten 127-run innings, and the newfound fame that has followed the team's success. She also reflects on the crucial contributions from teammates like Deepti Sharma and Richa Ghosh, and the immense pressure of the tournament. In the interview, Rodrigues reveals her mindset during the critical match: 'I just want to do it to help India win. It's not about me. It's not about my score. It's about making India win.' The conversation also covers her journey to the Women's Big Bash League in Australia immediately following the win.

IND-A vs SA-A: Ruturaj Gaikwad's ton steers India to 4-wicket win in 1st ODIRuturaj Gaikwad's brilliant century helped India A secure a four-wicket victory over South Africa A in the first unofficial ODI. Gaikwad played a magnificent innings of 117 (129) to help India chase down 286 in 49.3 overs.

IND vs SA 1st Test, pitch and weather conditions: Will Eden Gardens spin from Day 1?India host South Africa in a two-match Test series starting November 14 at Eden Gardens. The sporting pitch and clear weather promise an exciting contest with both teams eager to assert dominance.

India has been at the heart of SA20's journey from the start: Graeme SmithSA20 commissioner Graeme Smith says India's support has been crucial to the league's growth since its launch. With IPL-owned teams and rising fan engagement, SA20 is strengthening its footprint ahead of Season 4.

Yashasvi Jaiswal not aiming to replace Kohli, Rohit in Tests: Can't fill their shoesYashasvi Jaiswal says he is not trying to fill the shoes of Rohit Sharma or Virat Kohli as India enters a new Test era. With South Africa up next, the young opener remains focused on backing his own strengths.

Watch: Alyssa Healy exorcises Jemimah, World Cup demons with calm catch in WBBLAustralian captain Alyssa Healy redeemed herself from a World Cup mishap by taking a crucial catch and scoring 37 off 26 for the Sydney Sixers in the WBBL. Despite her efforts, the Hobart Hurricanes chased down 152 with six wickets in hand.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
